title: Fast approximate Bayesian inference of HIV indicators using PCA adaptive Gauss-Hermite quadrature
summary: This paper presents Naomi, a spatial evidence synthesis model for producing district-level HIV epidemic indicators in sub-Saharan Africa. It jointly models multiple outcomes using household survey data and health system data, providing a tool for countries to generate estimates.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions "spatial evidence synthesis model" and "household survey data", directly linking to "Spatio Temporal" and "Survey data". The modeling of district-level indicators with survey data also implies a contextual aspect.
